challenges.title: Say Hello World
description: Welcome. Let's try some coding lessons.
Do you see the code in your text editor to the right that says <h1>Hello</h1>? That's HTML.
Here you will change some text between the angle brackets.
To pass each lesson you need to change the code and then click the Run tests button below.
When you pass the test you will see a big checkbox with a submit button, click the submit button to continue.
<hr>
To pass this lesson, change your text to say "Hello World".

tests.text: Your h1 element should have the text "Hello World".
tests.testString: assert.isTrue((/hello(\s)+world/gi).test($('h1').text()), 'Your h1 element should have the text "Hello World".');

challenges.title: Headline with an h2 Element
description: HTML uses words with angle brackets like <h2> and </h2> which are called elements.
You will now make a new heading with an h2 element. Like this <h2>Hello</h2>
The h1 is for a main heading, while the h2 is for subheadings.
Remember to pass each lesson you need to change the code and then click the Run tests button below.
and when you pass the test you will see a big checkbox with a submit button, click the submit button to continue.
<hr>
Below the "Hello World" line make an h2 with text that says "CatPhotoApp"
tests:
assert(code.match(/<\/h2>/g) && code.match(/<\/h2>/g).length === code.match(/

/g).length, 'message: Make sure your h2 element has a closing tag.');
assert.isTrue((/cat(\s)?photo(\s)?app/gi).test($("h2").text()), 'message: Your h2 element should have the text "CatPhotoApp".');
assert.isTrue((/hello(\s)+world/gi).test($("h1").text()), 'message: Your h1 element should have the text "Hello World".');

challenges.title: Change the Color of Text
description: Now let's change the color of some of our text using CSS.
CSS is a language used to style HTML elements.
We can change text color by using the word color followed by a colon : and then a color. Like this:
color: blue;
<hr>
Change your h2 element's style so that its text color is red.
tests: assert($("h2").css("color") === "rgb(255, 0, 0)", 'message: Your h2 element should be red.');

challenges.title: Make Text Bold
description: To make text bold, you can use the strong element.
Like this, <strong>Hello</strong>.
<hr>
Wrap the words "Larry Page" inside a strong element.
challengeSeed: Google was founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin while they were Ph.D. students at Stanford University.
tests: assert($('strong').length == 1, 'message: Your code should add one strong element to the markup.');
assert($('p').children('strong').length == 1, 'message: The strong element should be inside the p tag.');
assert($('strong').text().match(/Larry Page/gi), 'message: The strong element should wrap around the words "Larry Page".');

challenges.title: Change the Background Color
description: You can add a background color to text that you want to emphasize.
You can change background color by using the word background-color followed by a colon : and then a color. Like this:
background-color: green;
<hr>
Change the background-color of the h4 element to yellow.
challengeSeed: Google was founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin while they were Ph.D. students at Stanford University.
tests: assert($("h4").css("background-color") === "rgb(255, 255, 0)", 'message: Your h2 element should be yellow.');

challenges.title: Add Two Numbers with JavaScript
description: JavaScript is a programming language that is used on the web.
Let's try to add two numbers.
JavaScript uses the + symbol as addition operation when placed between two numbers.
Example
5 + 10
<hr>
Change the 0 so that sum will equal 20.

challenges.title: Subtract One Number from Another
description: We can also subtract one number from another.
JavaScript uses the - symbol for subtraction.
Example
12 - 6
<hr>
Change the 0 so the difference is 12.

challenges.title: Addition with Variables
description: Variables let us store a number for later use.
var a = 5;
We can then use the variable instead of the number. Like this:
a + a
<hr>
Instead of adding a to 4, add a to b.
